Description: Ostracon, large section of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a brown slip, which has worn away in many parts, and faint traces of many lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394684) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394684)
